concept.title: User Interface: Gallery View
concept.shortdesc: A grid-style gallery view in the document library of Share that helps users visually focus on content.

section.title: Accessing the View
section.p: The gallery view is accesible from any Share site's project library or the main Repository Browser by clicking the grid icon next to the simple and detail views.
Once selected you should see a grid of thumbnails for content within the space you're browsing.
Note that much like the simple and detail views, as soon as the gallery view is selected it is saved as the default for the current user for all document library views.

section.title: Adjusting Thumbnail Size
section.p: You can change the number of columns displayed in the grid by moving the slider just under the view select buttons.
The size of the thumbnails will adjust based on your browser width and the number of columns selected
Note that as the number of columns is changed the new value is saved as the default for the current user for all document library views.

section.title: Navigation
section.p: To navigate to a folder or details click on the name of the item.

section.title: Metadata and Actions
section.p: To see additional metadata for an item or to perform actions on it click the info panel icon which appears once your mouse is hovering over an item. On touch devices, click an item once to reveal the info icon.
Clicking the info panel reveals an info panel where you can see and edit additional metadata and perform the same actions available in the simple and detail views.

section.title: Selecting Multiple Items
section.p: To select an item click the select checkbox which appears once your mouse is hovering over an item. On touch devices, click an item once to reveal the select checkbox.
Once an item is selected it will exhibit a blue border and unselected items will be dimmed.
If any item is selected you can make additional selections by just clicking on the content's thumbnail.
After you have made your selections you can perform actions against them using the selected items pull-down.
